@hazelflag Not long after I moved to Seattle in the early 90s, Paul Allen refurbished the Cinerama Theater, and they ran a series of revival prints...LAWRENCE OF ARABIA was one of them. I'd seen it on TV screens growing up, but that was the first time I truly "got it". I. Was. Mesmerized.

@HarpyMaslow Sticking with the desert epic theme, I’d cite Lawrence of Arabia. The characters get a much wider emotional dynamic range, the film has much more varied pacing and tone, and while it is beautifully shot and revels in visuals it does not simply dawdle to gawk.

Peter O'Toole's Lawrence of Arabia had a great line that sublimely reflects a lesson in paradigm:
"My fear is my own concern"

To paraphrase as a msg for the muppet mayor:
"Your offense is your own concern"

(ie, Youve no business being offended for anyone but yourself)
